eu.infomas.annotation

Class ClassPathScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.infomas.annotation.ClassPathScanner

  • public class ClassPathScanner
extends Object
    ClassFileIterator is used to iterate over all Java ClassFile files available within a specific context.

    For every Java ClassFile (.class) an InputStream is returned.

    Since:
    annotation-detector 3.0.0
    Author:
    Ronald K. Muller, Dan Armbrust Copied this code from ClassFileIterator and made slight changes to allow it to report arbitrary file types, rather than .class files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClassPathScanner(File[] filesOrDirectories, String[] pkgNameFilter, String extension)
      Create a new ClassFileIterator returning all Java ClassFile files available from the specified files and/or directories, including sub directories.
      ClassPathScanner(String extension)
      Create a new ClassFileIterator returning all Java ClassFile files available from the class path (System.getProperty("java.class.path")).
      ClassPathScanner(String[] pkgNameFilter, String extension) 

    • Method Summary

      Return the name of the Java ClassFile returned from the last call to next().

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassPathScanner

        public ClassPathScanner(String extension)
                 throws IOException
        Create a new ClassFileIterator returning all Java ClassFile files available from the class path (System.getProperty("java.class.path")).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • ClassPathScanner

        public ClassPathScanner(String[] pkgNameFilter,
                        String extension)
                 throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • ClassPathScanner

        public ClassPathScanner(File[] filesOrDirectories,
                        String[] pkgNameFilter,
                        String extension)
                 throws IOException
        Create a new ClassFileIterator returning all Java ClassFile files available from the specified files and/or directories, including sub directories.

        If the (optional) package filter is defined, only class files staring with one of the defined package names are returned. NOTE: package names must be defined in the native format (using '/' instead of '.').

        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the name of the Java ClassFile returned from the last call to next(). The name is either the path name of a file or the name of an ZIP/JAR file entry.

      • getModifyTime

        public long getModifyTime()

      • isFile

        public boolean isFile()
        Return true if the current InputStream is reading from a plain File. Return false if the current InputStream is reading from a ZIP File Entry.

      • next

        public InputStream next()
                 throws IOException
        Return the next Java ClassFile as an InputStream.

        NOTICE: Client code MUST close the returned InputStream!

        Throws:
        IOException
